column2: MT DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: Montana
column6: MT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Warning signs normally are:
column4: triangles.
column6: rectangles.

column2: 2. When changing lanes, you should:
column4: signal, change lanes and check your mirrors.
column6: signal and change lanes.
column8: signal, check your mirrors and blind spot in the direction you plan to move, then change lanes.
column10: check your mirrors, signal and change lanes.

column2: 3. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column6: Warning: drunk drivers.
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 4. When you leave your vehicle unattended, you must:
column4: lock the ignition and remove the ignition key.
column6: turn off the engine.

column2: 5. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column6: Look through your back window for children.

column2: 6. If you missed your exit on a freeway, you should:
column4: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column6: None of the above.
column8: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column10: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad crossing
column6: 4-way stop

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 9. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column6: go to the next entrance ramp.
column8: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.

column2: 10. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column6: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column4: You can travel in either direction in this lane
column6: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 12. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column10: drive in the right lane only.

column2: 13. Passing is prohibited:
column4: at intersections.
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.

column2: 14. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: drive with your flashers on.
column6: slow down until it passes you.
column8: pull over to the side of the road and stop.
column10: increase your speed to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle.

column2: 15. While driving, it is important to slow down:
column4: when the road is wet.
column6: on narrow roads.

column2: 16. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column4: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.
column6: look over your left shoulder.
column10: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.

column2: 17. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: following a motorcycle.
column6: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.

column2: 18. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends
column6: Keep right
column8: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 20. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: narrower and shorter
column6: darker

column2: 21. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column8: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.

column2: 22. When an approaching driver at night blinds you by failing to dim their high beams, you should look:
column4: towards the right side of the road.
column6: straight down the middle of the road.
column8: towards the left side of the road.
column10: None of the other answers is correct.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Right turns not allowed.
column6: Warning: U-turn ahead.

column2: 24. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column8: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column6: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic

column2: 26. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if a stop sign is posted.
column6: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column8: if a crossing gate is lowered.

column2: 27. Because many crashes happen when a vehicle is turning left, drivers should:
column4: slow down gradually while checking the rear view mirror.
column6: move into the left lane of a multilane road.
column8: yield to oncoming vehicles, bicyclists and pedestrians.

column2: 28. Distracted driving:
column4: usually causes the driver to drive slower.
column6: causes the driver to react more slowly to hazards.
column10: is only dangerous for inexperienced drivers.

column2: 29. You may pass another vehicle:
column4: on the shoulder of the highway.
column6: when there is a solid yellow line on your side.
column8: on a curve or a hill.

column2: 30. Road signs that point out scenic areas and parks are:
column4: black and white.
column6: brown and white.

column2: 31. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column10: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.

column2: 32. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
column4: changes in traffic lanes.
column6: road construction.

column2: 33. Road rage and aggressive driving may be caused by:
column4: unsafe lane changes.
column6: tailgating.

column2: 31. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column10: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.

column2: 32. This sign is used to warn drivers about:
column4: changes in traffic lanes.
column6: road construction.

column2: 33. Road rage and aggressive driving may be caused by:
column4: unsafe lane changes.
column6: tailgating.
